hotelTagline: Restored landmark hotel in downtown San Francisco
shortDescription: A member of The Luxury Collection of Starwood Hotels and Resorts, this legendary 1909 hotel in downtown San Francisco is 1 block from the Financial District, 3 blocks from Union Square, and 4 blocks from Moscone Center.

hotelRoomResponse.cancellationPolicy:
We understand that sometimes plans fall through. We do not charge a cancel or change fee. When the hotel charges such fees in accordance with its own policies, the cost will be passed on to you. Palace Hotel - Luxury Collection charges the following cancellation and change fees.

Cancellations or changes made before 4:00 PM (hotel local time) on September 27, 2014 or no-shows are subject to a hotel fee equal to the first night's rate plus taxes and fees.

Cancellations or changes made after 4:00 PM (hotel local time) on September 27, 2014 or no-shows are subject to a hotel fee equal to 100% of the total amount paid for the reservation.

Your room will be guaranteed for late arrival.

Hotel supplier loyalty points and/or airline miles may not be awarded when booking an Expedia Special Rate hotel.
hotelRoomResponse.roomLongDescription: 2 double   Get a good night's sleep with premium bedding and blackout drapes/curtains. Wired and wireless Internet access (surcharge) keeps you connected, and the 37-inch flat-screen TV is offered for your entertainment. You can request an in-room massage. You will have a shower/tub combination, as well as bathrobes, designer toiletries, and complimentary toiletries. Air conditioning, complimentary bottled water, and a laptop-compatible safe are among the conveniences offered. This room is Non-Smoking.

longDescription:
Union Square: 3 blocks: A member of The Luxury Collection of Starwood Hotels and Resorts, this legendary 1909 hotel in downtown San Francisco is 1 block from the Financial District, 3 blocks from Union Square, and 4 blocks from Moscone Center.

Garden Court grandeur: The Palace Hotel's resplendent Garden Court, with a stained-glass dome, is considered one of the world's most beautiful dining rooms. A famous mural by Maxfield Parrish takes center stage in the Pied Piper Bar.

Lofty ceilings: Elegantly traditional in design, guestrooms at the Palace Hotel feature 14-foot ceilings and polished mahogany furniture. Beds indulge with plush-top mattresses and down duvets.

Rooms
Elegantly traditional in design, guestrooms feature 14-foot ceilings and gleaming mahogany furniture. Beds indulge with plush-top mattresses and down duvets. High-speed Internet access is available for a surcharge. Laptop-compatible in-room safe. Complimentary bottled water is provided daily. Rooms also have large desks and 37-inch flat-screen TV with pay movies. Bathrooms include marble vanities, designer toiletries, makeup/shaving mirrors, bathrobes, phones, and scales. Some suites have jetted tubs. Overnight shoeshine is complimentary. Coffeemakers are provided upon request, based on availability.

Awards

  • The property is a member of Historic Hotels of America.

Dining
Garden Court - Majestic, atrium-style dining room with soaring stained-glass dome, lush greenery, and Austrian-crystal chandeliers. Renowned Palace Jazz Brunch each Sunday, with jazz trio, fresh seafood, Asian specialties, omelet and crêpe station, unlimited sparkling wine, and lavish dessert buffet. À la carte and buffet breakfast, à la carte lunch Monday-Saturday, and Saturday-afternoon high tea. Maxfield's Restaurant - Innovative California cuisine in a richly historic setting, including mosaic floor from 1909 and coffered, stained-glass ceiling. Menu may include Goat Cheese Soufflé, Sonoma Rack of Lamb, Black Angus Filet with Wild Mushrooms, and Brownie Baked Alaska. Lunch and dinner daily. Pied Piper Bar - Home of the Maxfield Parrish mural The Pied Piper of Hamelin, painted for the hotel's reopening in 1909. Polished dark woods and coffered ceiling evoke a San Francisco gentlemen's club of the early 1900s. Open daily for cocktails, beer, wine, and specialty coffee drinks.

Fees

  • The following fees and deposits are charged by the property at time of service, check-in, or check-out.
    • Fee for in-room wireless Internet: USD 15.00 per 24-hour period (rates may vary)
    • Fee for in-room high-speed Internet (wired): USD 15.00 per 24-hour period (rates may vary)
    • Fee for wireless Internet in public areas: USD 8.00 per hour (rates may vary)
    • Valet parking fee: USD 59 per day (in/out privileges)
  • The above list may not be comprehensive. Fees and deposits may not include tax and are subject to change.

Location Highlights

  • In shopping district
  • Metro station nearby
  • Train station nearby
  • In business district
  • In city center
  • In historical district

Property Amenities
This downtown San Francisco hotel is just a block from the Financial District. Union Square and top-name stores such as Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus, Macy's, Armani, Bulgari, Levi's flagship store, and Gump's San Francisco are within 2 or 3 blocks. Palace Hotel - Luxury Collection is a member of the Luxury Collection, which includes more than 85 Starwood Hotels and Resorts in more than 30 locations around the world. It offers 3 restaurants, along with the celebrated Pied Piper Bar. The health club features a skylit pool, a eucalyptus sauna, and a fitness center. Facials include a complimentary hand, arm, shoulder, and neck massage. Guests can order poolside refreshments from room service.

Recreation
Located on the fourth floor, the health club features a skylit lap pool, along with a sauna, and fitness center. The Palace is about 4.5 miles from the historic Presidio Golf Course, rejuvenated under the supervision of Arnold Palmer Golf Management. The recreational activities listed below are available either on site or near the hotel; fees may apply.

  • Golfing nearby
  • Sailing nearby
  • Scooter/moped rentals nearby
